isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL® VT 365 DIESEL ENGINE - FRONT COVER, VIBRATION DAMPER, and GEROTOR OIL PUMP - Removal - Front Oil Seal and Wear Sleeve

svcproc.title: Front Oil Seal and Wear Sleeve

note.para: The VT 365 is not equipped with a wear sleeve during factory production. Wear sleeves are available with an oil seal service kit.
If removing only the seal, do steps 1 through 3. Otherwise, remove seal and wear sleeve by doing steps 1 through 4.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields to protect eyes.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not immerse damper in petroleum based solvents. Damage to rubber damping element may result.

step1.para: With an awl and hammer, punch two holes 180° apart into the front oil seal.
Thread a slide hammer with an appropriately sized screw into one of the two holes.
Slide hammer until one side of the seal begins to pull out the gerotor cover. Move the slide hammer to the other hole and repeat until the front oil seal is removed.

note.para: The following steps are necessary if the engine has a front wear sleeve. Wear sleeves are only available in oil seal service kits.

step1.para: Do the following steps to install the Front Wear Sleeve Remover :

figure.caption: Figure 220. Removal of front wear sleeve

step2.para: Install the tools two half shell ridges behind the front wear sleeve.
Place the threaded shaft and pulling flange within the two shells while holding the shells together.
Thread the shaft up to the crankshaft, and apply tension to the two half shells. Remove the wear sleeve.
